Matt,
 I believe it to be a "tsukushi-naginata" , shaft inserted into metal 
loop on back of the blade, quite rare and similar to the "ta-no-saki" 
naginata which had a socket at the base to which a shaft was fitted, 
both very different ways of mounting the shaft to the more common 
naginata that we see.
regards
John
